sections.title: Introduction (Wide Shot)
sections.content: Hey everyone, I’m Jihad Al Sayed, and today we’re going beyond theory — we’re applying linear systems to real-world problems in tech, science, and engineering. Let’s see how these equations run the world behind the scenes.

sections.title: Application: Electrical Circuits
sections.content: Using Kirchhoff’s laws, we can set up systems of equations to calculate current or voltage in circuits. Each loop gives us a linear equation.

sections.title: Application: Network Flow
sections.content: In a traffic or data network, flow conservation at each node leads to a system of equations. Solving it gives us the optimal distribution across the network.

sections.title: Application: Economics
sections.content: Linear systems model supply and demand, input-output models in economics, and cost optimization in production systems.

sections.title: Application: 3D Graphics
sections.content: Every 3D object you see in games or simulations is transformed using matrices. Translation, rotation, and scaling are all linear operations.

sections.title: Recap
sections.content: We looked at how linear systems model real-world problems: circuits, networks, economics, and graphics. These aren’t just equations — they’re tools for solving problems across every major field.
